CatDescriptText: Mrs. Nancy McCormick, housewife, Oakland and Mr. John Collins, East Pittsburgh, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 1, 1961, pg. A1  with question: "Do you think ethnic groups (like the Negro people) profit more by voting a straight party ticket, or are there better advantages for them in splitting a ticket?"  Mrs. Nancy McCormick's answer reads: "I think the straight party vote and for the Democratic party, because it does more than any other party."  Mr. John Collins' answer reads: "I figure the best is the straight vote.  One reason is that you get more than if you split the vote.  By a straight party vote, you have more to fight with."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Nancy McCormick wearing dark shirt with light colored stripe and eyeglasses, standing with buildings in background; Portrait of John Collins wearing striped necktie and hat, standing in front of store window with mosaic tile wall
